media.title: Pokémon - I Choose You!
media.description: Meet Ash Ketchum, a 10-year-old boy full of imagination, confidence, and dreams that are almost too big for his village of Pallet Town—plus the desire to become a Pokémon Master!

media.title: Pokémon Emergency
media.description: The city's on high alert for Pokémon thieves—thieves like Jessie, James, and Meowth of Team Rocket, a group of bad guys dedicated to stealing valuable Pokémon.

media.title: Ash Catches a Pokémon
media.description: Team Rocket shows up to steal Pikachu—they realize that there's really something special about this Pokémon—and Ash vows to defend himself.

media.title: Challenge of the Samurai
media.description: Samurai challenges Ash to a battle, and Ash gets the advantage when his Metapod defends itself against Samurai's Pinsir.

media.title: Showdown in Pewter City
media.description: Jessie, James, and Meowth dig a trap for our heroes, but they end up falling into it themselves!

media.title: Clefairy and the Moon Stone
media.description: Will Team Rocket steal the Moon Stone? Are there other Clefairy lurking about, and do they carry Moon Stones, too? And is the legend of the Moon Stone true?

media.title: The Water Flowers of Cerulean City
media.description: Ash seeks the Cascade badge in Cerulean City—but for some reason, Misty doesn't want to join them. When Ash and Brock show up, the city is buzzing about a break-in that just took place—and are initially accused of the crime!

media.title: The Path to the Pokémon League
media.description: After earning his second badge, Ash sets off triumphantly for Vermilion City. Along the way, he hears of AJ, a Trainer on the brink of 100 straight victories. Full of confidence, Ash challenges this fearsome Trainer!

media.title: The School of Hard Knocks
media.description: While searching for firewood in the foggy woods, Ash and Pikachu discover a bunch of prep-school kids bullying a classmate named Joe.

media.title: Bulbasaur and the Hidden Village
media.description: Ash and Misty, while arguing, discover an Oddish. As Misty's Starmie weakens the Oddish, a Bulbasaur appears and fights Starmie while the Oddish runs off into the woods.

media.title: Charmander-The Stray Pokémon
media.description: Our friends, lost, discover an injured Charmander. Pikachu talks to it and learns that it's been waiting a long time for its trainer to return.

media.title: Here Comes the Squirtle Squad
media.description: Ash and his friends walk along a path and fall into a hole dug by a batch of mischievous Squirtle. Ash climbs out and tries to battle them, but they scatter when Officer Jenny arrives.

media.title: Mystery at the Lighthouse
media.description: A tremendously large shadow begins to take form in the sea mists, but this possible discovery could be hindered due to the infamous Team Rocket lurking in the background cooking up another one of their schemes.

media.title: Electric Shock Showdown
media.description: Eager to earn a badge, Ash challenges Lt. Surge. Pikachu reluctantly enters the battle, only to discover that its opponent is a Raichu, a fierce Pokémon with tremendous electric power—and the evolved form of Pikachu!

media.title: Battle Aboard the St. Anne
media.description: Ash and his friends board a fancy cruise ship called the St. Anne, thanks to tickets provided by two friendly but familiar-looking people. We soon learn that they're actually Jessie and James in disguise!

media.title: Pokémon Shipwreck
media.description: Our heroes are revealed in the middle of a trap concocted by Team Rocket.

media.title: Island of the Giant Pokémon
media.description: As our heroes and Team Rocket beat the odds by surviving the sinking ship, they are dragged into another potentially deadly situation when they are attacked by the ferocious Pokémon, Gyarados.

media.title: Tentacool & Tentacruel
media.description: Our heroes arrive at Hutber Port, where a ferryboat line runs to the mainland.

media.title: The Ghost of Maiden's Peak
media.description: After leaving Acapulco in search of Saffron City, our heroes finally arrive at a small port town in the middle of celebrating a summer festival.

media.title: Bye Bye Butterfree
media.description: When the party sees a flock of Butterfree flying above the ocean, Brock, as a Pokémon breeder, explains that it is the Butterfree's egg-laying season.

media.title: Abra and the Psychic Showdown
media.description: The party finally arrives in Saffron City where a young girl manages a gym of Pokémon using her psychic powers. If Ash defeats this particular Gym Leader, Ash can earn a gold badge.

media.title: The Tower of Terror
media.description: In search of a ghost Pokémon, Ash heads immediately for a tower in Lavender Town where they are said to dwell.

media.title: Haunter vs. Kadabra
media.description: Unbenownst to Ash, one of the ghost Pokémon decides to join Ash and friends on their journey and more importantly help Ash battle the powerful Saffron City Gym Leader.

media.title: Primeape Goes Bananas
media.description: On their way to Celadon City, our heroes encounter Mankey, a wild Pokémon that if rubbed the wrong way can go into uncontrollable fits.

media.title: Pokémon Scent-sation!
media.description: The party arrives in Celadon City, a perfectly pleasant town full of large department stores, condominiums, and fancy arcades.

media.title: Hypno's Naptime
media.description: Our heroes come to a town in which a great deal of children have recently turned up missing.

media.title: Pokémon Fashion Flash
media.description: At Brock's persistent request, our heroes stop by Caesar Street, a town of breeders famous for its Pokémon beauty salons.

media.title: The Punchy Pokémon
media.description: In the outskirts of Fuchsia City, our heroes come across Hitmonchan, a fighter-Pokémon. With little thought, Ash attempts to capture it, but he and Pikachu are badly defeated.

media.title: Sparks Fly for Magnemite
media.description: As our heroes make their way through the industrial town of Gringy City, Pikachu, perhaps weary from travel, is in a strange state; the electric sacks on his cheeks are continually twitching as though overcharged.

media.title: Dig Those Diglett!
media.description: Ash, Brock, Misty and Pikachu are lost deep in the mountains. As they press forward on a rough road not even shown on their map, they suddenly hear a large explosion.

media.title: The Ninja Poké-Showdown
media.description: Fuchsia Gym, the authorized gym where Ash seeks his next badge, turns out to be a hidden ninja's lair. After finally discovering and entering the gym, he is held up by a complex system of traps.

media.title: The Flame Pokémon-athon!
media.description: Our heroes come to a prairie where the Laramies, a family of Pokémon Ranchers live. They learn from a daughter of the Laramie family that a race is held at the ranch once a year to measure the growth of everyone's Pokémon.

media.title: The Kangaskhan Kid
media.description: Without knowing they are in a region in which Pokémon are protected, Ash tries to capture a Chansey and is arrested by Jenny, the safari ranger.

media.title: The Bridge Bike Gang
media.description: In the course of a journey, one meets up with many different things. Returning to civilization after a long period of wandering, our heroes find a bridge that reaches 20 kilometers in length.

media.title: Ditto's Mysterious Mansion
media.description: Being caught in a sudden rain shower, our heroes are obliged to seek shelter. In the middle of a clearing, they find a small, ghastly cabin.

media.title: Pikachu's Goodbye
media.description: Misty and Brock continue to journey with Ash as he seeks to become a Pokémon Master. Passing through a beautiful forest, the three of them stop for a rest.

media.title: The Battling Eevee Brothers
media.description: Tracing a path through the woods, the party comes across a tree baited with a plate of food and water. An Eevee is bound to the trunk with string.

media.title: Wake Up Snorlax!
media.description: On empty stomachs, our heroes' search for food brings them to a small village, but find there is no food at the bakery nor at the grocery store; even the town restaurant is out of food.

media.title: Showdown at Dark City
media.description: In the middle of a terrible desert, our heroes inadvertently wandered into Dark City. With no name but Dark, the city has fallen into ruin.

media.title: The March of the Exeggutor Squad
media.description: Our heroes continue their Pokémon training without a break even over spring vacation, when what should appear before them but a carnival.

media.title: The Problem with Paras
media.description: Team Rocket never let up with their constant interception, but today something seems strange. The coin on Meowth's forehead is blinking red, indicating overheating.

media.title: The Song of Jigglypuff
media.description: Our heroes trudge along, resigning themselves to the idea of camping out in the desert as the sun slowly sets. Suddenly they see bright lights in front of them: a glamorous city appears before them, covered in neon lights.

media.title: Attack of the Prehistoric Pokémon
media.description: Our heroes approach Grampa Canyon, famous for the beautiful scenery of its valley. As they approach, however, they find wave upon wave of people also heading for Grampa Canyon.

media.title: A Chansey Operation
media.description: As our heroes sleep peacefully, Pikachu begins experiencing an unusual sensation. As though it were choking on something, Pikachu's expression grows steadily more and more pained.

media.title: Holy Matrimony!
media.description: As our heroes pass the entrance to a small village, they stop in front of a strange sign.

media.title: So Near, Yet So Farfetch'd
media.description: As Ash sits on a rock, staring at his Pokédex, it displays Farfetch'd, an odd-looking Pokémon holding a leek.

media.title: Who Gets To Keep Togepi?
media.description: When Ash and friends reach a certain Pokémon E. R., Joy informs Ash that a message has arrived for him, from Professor Oak.

media.title: Bulbasaur's Mysterious Garden
media.description: In the course of his journey, Ash battles a mountaineer Pokémon trainer he encountered in a small wooded area.

media.title: The Case of the K-9 Caper!
media.description: Ash enrolls Pikachu in a training school for police Growlithe, but the course is tougher than he imagined, for himself and for Pikachu!

media.title: Pokémon Paparazzi
media.description: Ash and friends are being shadowed by Snap, the world's greatest Pokémon photographer.

media.title: The Ultimate Test
media.description: Ash signs up to take an exam to be admitted to the Pokémon League.

media.title: The Breeding Center Secret
media.description: Our heroes discover a terrible secret about the new breeding center in town.
